meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be knowledgeable or clever.
meanings.sent1: The wiseacres at school always acted like they knew everything.
meanings.sent2: The wiseacres in the office were always quick to offer their opinions.
meanings.sent3: The wiseacres at the party were amusing everyone with their fake wisdom.
meanings.sent4: She saw through his facade of wisdom; he was just a wiseacre in disguise.
meanings.sent5: The wiseacres in the group discussion were easily spotted by their false confidence.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are considered to be wise or knowledgeable.
meanings.sent1: The village elders were seen as the wiseacres of the community.
meanings.sent2: The wiseacres gathered around the fire to share their insights.
meanings.sent3: The wiseacres of the town council made important decisions together.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the owls were known as the wiseacres of the night.
meanings.sent5: The wiseacres of the group always had valuable advice to offer.
